column1: There was only porridge and milk for breakfast
column2: so it took but a short time to eat it
column3: and then the real work of the day began. The Shepherd put on his Kilmarnock bonnet and called Tam
column4: who had had his breakfast on the hearth
column5: and the two went away to the hills after the sheep. Jock led the cow to a patch of green turf near the bottom of the hill
column6: where she could find fresh pasture
column7: and Jean was left alone in the kitchen of the little gray house. Ah
column8: you should have seen her then! She washed the dishes and put them away in the cupboard
column9: she skimmed the milk and put the cream into the churn
column10: she swept the hearth and shook the blankets out of doors in the fresh morning air. Then she made the beds
column11: and when the kitchen was all in order
column12: she "went ben"—that was the way they spoke of the best room—and dusted that too.
